result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston Lee Ciocarelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
fined $10 plus costs, DNA surcharge listed separately  
pay as required by Probation and Parole  
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment will be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

$510 restitution to victim, apply bail  
pay remainder as required by Probation and Parole  
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment will be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Submit a DNA sample (if not done previously)
